intro: Espeletia jaramilloi, commonly known as the Jaramillo's espeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces showy, daisy-like inflorescences that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays a significant role in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
